definition: Summer Palace in Beijing
cheek/lower cheek/chin/jaw/to nourish
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname Yuan
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: From which dynasty was the blue---flower porcelain plate in the Hall of Happiness and Longevity left?
sentences.chinese: 颐和园乐寿堂内的青花大磁盘是哪个朝代的遗物？

sentences.english: Please tell me on which days students in primary schools and high schools can visit the summer palace for free.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我在哪天小学和高中生可以免费参观颐和园？

sentences.english: north-west / north-west; The Summer Palace is north-west of Beijing. / The Summer Palace is north-west of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 颐和园在北京的西北部。

sentences.english: Tourists walk in the Summer Palace with deliberate steps.
Yesterday I visited the Summer Palance, where I had not been for a long while.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我到颐和园参观，我很久没到那里去了。

sentences.english: That was the fourth time that Mr Smoth has visited the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 这是史密斯先生第三次游览颐和园。

sentences.english: Longevity Hill is the focal point of the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 万寿山是颐和园的视觉中心。

sentences.english: The Summer Palace is the most beautiful park in Beijing. The Temple of Heaven and the Great Wall are worth visiting.
sentences.chinese: 颐和园是北京最美丽的公园，天坛和长城都值得一去。

sentences.english: Colin: Oh yes, I’m very interested in Chinese history so I’d like to visit the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我对中国历史很有兴趣，所以我很想去颐和园。

sentences.english: We visited the Summer Place, the Forbidden City, Ming Tombs and many parks there.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了颐和园，故宫，明十三陵还有好多公园。

sentences.english: To go to both the Ming Tombs and the Summer Palace?
sentences.chinese: 明十三陵和颐和园皆能去吗？

sentences.english: Only the Lobgevity Hill remains inside the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 只有这万寿山在颐和园里边。

sentences.english: The Summer Palace covers an area of 290 hectares, including the areas of Kuming Lake and Longevity Hill.
sentences.chinese: 颐和园占地290公顷，包括昆明湖和万寿山。

sentences.english: The visitors were transported to the Summer Palace by a wooden boat.
sentences.chinese: 游客们坐着木船被送到了颐和园。

sentences.english: Mr Smoth has visited the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 这是史密斯先生第三次游览颐和园。

sentences.english: The summer Palace is the largest and the best pre - served of the imperial gardens in China.
sentences.chinese: 颐和园是中国最大也是保存得最好的皇家花园。

definition: Yuanmingyuan, the Old Summer Palace, destroyed by the British and French army in 1860
Jingshan Park (park in Beijing)
Kunming Lake
Jingshan (name of a hill in Jingshan park)
the Forbidden City/the Imperial Palace in Beijing/same as 故宮|故宫[Gu4 gong1]
Shichahai, scenic area of northwest Beijing with three lakes
Tower of Buddhist Incense in the Summer Palace 頤和園|颐和园[Yi2 he2 yuan2], Beijing
Temple of Heaven (in Beijing)
the Ming tombs (mausoleum park of the Ming emperors in Changping district of Beijing)
mountain resort/Qing imperial summer residence at Chengde, a world heritage site
former imperial palace
the Forbidden City/abbr. for 故宮博物院|故宫博物院[Gu4 gong1 Bo2 wu4 yuan4]
Tiananmen Gate, entrance of the Imperial City in Beijing
Fragrant Hills Park, Beijing
Mukden Palace, aka Shenyang Imperial Palace, the main imperial palace during the early years of the Qing dynasty (1625-1644), a secondary palace in subsequent years, now a museum
Houhai, a lake and the area surrounding it in central Beijing
Badaling, a particular section of the Great Wall that is a favorite tourist destination
